title: Why are there Lulu Q buffs on PBE?
body:
Current PBE build: Lulu
Glitterlance (Q) AP ratio increased to 70% from 50%

I mean, the only thing you're going to accomplish with Q AP ratio buffs is moving Lulu into solo lanes...


Buffing AP ratios = improving their scaling = more useful with gold.
Supports aren't getting much gold, and even if they get some, they won't spend it on AP. This is because current AP support itemisation SUCKS, we have 1 legit AP support item.

Buffing damage = improving her ability to trade and most importantly TO WAVECLEAR. This is actually huge for solo lanes, not so much bot lane. Sure, damage makes her better at poke, but Lulu never was primarily poke support

replies.body:
We want to buff support Lulu. We also want to buff solo Lulu a bit. It's something we've had a lot of trouble with in the past but still believe should be in a stronger state than it currently is. 

Now, having said that the AP ratio increase doesn't accomplish both of those goals, given it does very little for support Lulu. Current plan is to replace that buff with something else as a result. It's the sort of unlikely to succeed change we'll occasionally do at the start of a patch cycle (often just internally, not on PBE).  Intent is often to get an understanding of what a champion would look like were that true in the current state of the game or sometimes for someone to test something out that they believe in even if wider consensus is it's unlikely to have the desired result.

"We want to buff support Lulu by giving her ap ratio buffs"

Support has barely any ap itemization. Explain yourself on this, Meddler.

> I didn't read anything after the first sentence, and I'm upset.

Ok.

The explanation only explains the lack of a thought process.

"We want to buff Lulu, but we wanna know where Lulu kinda "is" at the moment, so we're buffing something that we, as a company, actively discouraged supports from building."

This buff does almost absolutely nothing.

"We want Lulu to work as both a support and a solo laner. We sometimes throw in changes like this to see what happens, but we recognize that this doesn't affect both support and solo Lulu. It's one of the changes that probably won't make it, _but it will be replaced by something else later in the cycle_. Adding the AP ratios basically lets us see whether Lulu just needs more damage or different changes."

- summary of the comment
You, dear sir, are far too patient.
it's meddler, the dude who thinks Support Sona needing 600 ap to work is ok

whaaaaaat?! 
Are you implying Sona being able to half health the enemy ADC, but not be able to keep her own one alive is not a healthy support strategy!? 
That's like, Almost logical!?!

are you stupid or you never played Sona?

Sona's Q gives damage to her allies, and it doesn't give shit without 600 ap
Sona's E gives ms, still doesn't do shti without 600 AP
same for diminuendo
same for tempo

even to keep someone alive she needs 600 AP
and level 16

meanwhile nami's E gives a shit ton of damage+slow, she has a basic cc her heal is as much powerful as Sona, and movement speed is way better

uhh build the heal and shield buffing items and take windspeakers and your heals will be pretty good. she isnt suppose to heal like a soraka. she has a multiple person heal, a aoe movement speed buff, and a single auto damage buff, plus an area stun. she has alot of utility. she shouldnt also be one shotting people
Have you considered allowing her ult to interact with Windspeaker's Blessing and the +heal/shield stat? :)

I don't think she needs direct buff.
She is on the weaker side because she trades AP scaling on utility for base values. However, current support itemisation HEAVILY favours tanky stats and gold sinks in general (hp regen, mana regen, CDR, health).

If we had more items like {{item:3504}} and less tank support items she would be more than fine. Since you took {{item:3060}} away from AP supports {{item:3504}}{{item:3174}} are the only legitimate AP support items we have right now, and {{item:3174}} is on the weaker side as it suffers from having too much gold-sink stats.


Edit: I might as well ask, why are support items cluttered with gold-sink stats? Supports already have lowest amount of gold to work with, and i don't think they actually need HP regen on most of their items. Abilities of supports are WAY too expensive, 3 of Janna's abilities cost over 100 mana. It's ridiculous when you compare it to non-support champions.
{{item:3050}} is a support item with some AP, but its a stretch and not a universal buy by any means.
Honestly its extremely unreliable since you cant control the charges. Most of the time its better to get another item

This item needs a pretty good buff. Specifically around the gating of the passive. It isn't living up to its intended purpose.

To the end at which you reference champions like Janna, some champions will never be made into solo lane powerhouses because their kits cannot function that way without being incredibly unhealthy or simply un-fun.

I'd say her issue is more that she's incapable of doing her job. she's supposed to be a poke oriented support but her damage isn't good enough for how risky it is. Hard engage supports are too good at immediately jumping her as soon as she gets in range to poke and other utility supports heal and shield her poke too much for it to build up.

This results in her just being a completely passive, boring peel bot when Janna does that job (Shots fired!) far better than her.

totally agree with you, when i try to make risky play and stand up front. The reward is always small and I put myself in a very vulnerable place. Lacking damage and cannot tank enough damage at the same time. Janna just peel much safer and better than lulu. Even in lane, my aggressive may only gain my bot lane a small advantage, but that is very risky and the punishment is so large that you will feel like why i even try to be aggressive.

Thing is, why do people want to use Lulu as poke support?
Her Q is one point wonder that gains nothing but damage by leveling it, pro Lulu players max it last (also most Lulu players).
Shes support with the best peel we have, her Q is Zilean's slow but AOE and with ~4s CD, she has targeted hardCC which has no travel or cast time. Huge MS boost, decently sized shield, extremely powerful ultimate.

Lulu was okay to be a poke support if she hurts. Remember in the past, you basically have to max Q first because of the damage and the slow. Just now, she does not hurt anymore. Not poking, just tickling. And as a peeling support, her shield is decent yes, but unlike janna, she cannot protect herself nicely. She seems to have a protective skill set. But is it really that protective? the slow probably only delay 1-2s of death. The ultimate just delay 1s of death(probably). Either whimsy on ally or enemy cannot completely save her in a danger unless you flash. Think of janna, passive movement speed, hard CC and knockback. Janna even has higher skill range than her. She can peel for her carry while positioning safe and good. Lulu needs to stick close to the team fight and being one of the target in the team fight when she uses any of her spell. All of whimsy and shield is actually her auto attack range. In a team fight, people can find it easy to gap closer with this range.

As someone who plays a lot of Lulu in general, buffs to AP/shield support items would make the problem a whole lot worse. This would most likely put Lulu in a shittier spot than she currently is, because supports like Brand, Malz, Zyra, Vel, Nami, Soraka, and Sona can all abuse stats from the respective items much more effectively than Lulu - from experience, those are some of Lulu's harder matchups already, giving them more power means Lulu would see even less success than she currently has.

I really do like the idea of only applying her Q's damage reduction to minions, letting you still hit champions with full damage. There would be counterplay to this in the sense that you could position so that Lulu can't hit you and the wave at the same time, giving you a chance to push her in and force her to use mana on waveclear/shields while you harass her under tower. Lulu is very weak to poke, so a good Ziggs or Xerath could still destroy her in lane. This would also give her more identity as a poke based support, instead of the confused W/R bot she often ends up playing as. This would also let her stand a chance against other popular poke supports, since to hit them or the ADC, Lulu would likely have to Q from an E-ed minion, giving a chance to trade back because she blew two spells for the damage of one.

(deleted previous comment because mobile is being funky and I replied to wrong comment!)

> Edit: I might as well ask, why are support items cluttered with gold-sink stats? Supports already have lowest amount of gold to work with, and i don't think they actually need HP regen on most of their items. Abilities of supports are WAY too expensive, 3 of Janna's abilities cost over 100 mana. It's ridiculous when you compare it to non-support champions.

The simple answer is to make them unappealing to solo laners, though it is imo a very lazy/shallow way of doing so.

I've always been really troubled as to why support items provide so much of everything else, but not the stats the supports like. I understand the fear of moving "gold-sink stats" to AP in Athene is that mid laners might start picking it up, but then again, it's not very efficient for mids anymore. It also handicaps supports pretty hard being a 20% CDR item. Heck, in today's build, they added 5 MR to the item. Why?

Out of curiosity---

How come you're considering buffs for champions originally designed as supports (Lulu) to get them into a better position for both bot lane and their solo lane while other champions (Sona/Janna [not that Janna needs buffs]) aren't considered for solo lane opportunities?

I would like to see other champions designed as supports other than Lulu attempt a solo lane once in a while, too.

I'd imagine Janna won't get much in the way of solo lane opportunities is because she's incredibly uninteractive with her lane opponent, and has been in the past when she went mid-lane. Plop down tornado and walk away while it clears the wave once you have some AP while she has a slow, shield and ult to survive any attempt to do anything about her.

Not sure on Sona.

Well, I just threw them out there as an example and not those two support specifically. I understand why Janna will never get buffs because I used to play her mid before they nerfed her Q damage and gave it a ratio for the charge up.  

Sona, on the other hand, feels much better as a whole nowadays, but I still dislike her W. I'd rather she gave a better shield or better heal and not both. But that's getting off subject.

I'd like to see supports get buffs that allow them to easier slide into other lanes, but not without their inherent difficulties changing too much. Which may sound contradictory, but I know that stuff is hard to balance.

I mean, when you look at most supports, they either are possible in other lanes (Karma, Kench), or are so crafted around being a support that a lane kit for them would be super wonky and/or uninteractive (Braum, Soraka). Lulu has a kit that could technically work in other lanes, so it makes sense that you would try to accommodate for it.

He mentioned in his post that this is a placeholder buff to test the waters for future changes. You can't correct the course if you don't know where you currently stand, or how proceeding in a particular direction will affect the outcome.

I understand. D: But it has been a long time since solo lane Lulu and the nerfs and what not-- So it's not like the waters haven't been filtered, emptied, and refilled by then. :) 

Plus it's Meddler *fangirl scream*

If you're afraid of increasing her single target burst, rewarding players for landing both bolts (up to 100%) would be a nice start. 

Honestly, the AP change would be fine if the best/expected support itemization didn't include mandatory 0AP items. Athene's looked like a decent starting point, but it has way too little AP/too much CDR to feel appealing even as support.  

That said, the AP ratio increase feels really good early game (solo) and does help justify running AP runes on Lulu support.
I don't think an AP ratio buff helps all that much with the current state of support itemization. Most of the good items give little or no AP.

The main reason of this was to buff solo-lane Lulu, because it is barely played at the moment. 
I think the AP scaling was a great idea, because back when mage Lulu was viable, she was considered a lane bully. 

However, it has become increasingly difficult lately for her to win trades, primarily because she lacks damage output to follow up with her versatile kit. Her combos should seem more rewarding than they are at the moment. 
She also tended to fall off compared to other AP carries by late game, and the increase in scaling would make her once again a viable pick for solo lane, which was actually really fun :D . 

Please try to bring back these changes, AP Lulu was my favorite pick for the longest time (I'm probably not the only one) and this buff would bring back solo lane Lulu without harming the integrity of Lulu support, because you simply would build utility, and the AP scaling wouldn't matter too much.

You know that the second enemy hit by Glitterlance and beyond only takes 50% of the initial damage (i forget the exact amount) since they nerfed her solo lane potential?

This won't be THAT huge. She may deal a little more damage to a single target now, but it still doesn't help her wave clear (Which was good on top of her utility/safety in solo lane).  It shouldn't be a BIG problem but we'll see where it takes her.

God forbid she becomes the support bully she was meant to be again.

> God forbid she becomes the support bully she was meant to be again.

They are buffing the AP ratio and supports aren't really purchasing AP at the moment.

This is a buff for Lulu in mid-lane and top-lane which has minimal affect on her in the support role.
Find a way to make Lulu chain a Whimsy. I want to turn an entire team into seals at once

So you want lulu to be stuck as a support. Well soooo-rrryyy that some of us want to play her as a mage. 
:/

Riot doesn't want that, i don't really care about Lulu being in other lanes. I fear that SUPPORT Lulu will get nerfed AGAIN if she dares to go into solo lane.
If you want to play a mage, why don't you play actual mage tho?

Because she is awesome to use solo. Riot never nerfed mid annie because she was one-shotting as a support so I don't think its too fair to do this. Well hopefully I hope she doesn't become flavor of the month because that is a bad experience to have for the champs you like play.

Also to give you a clear perspective as to how my mind works. I like playing AD akali with {{item:3074}}  and full lethality. That's the type of guy I am :3
They probably want Lulu relevant again in the pro scene.
That's fine, but this change will lead to solo lane Lulu, which will lead to support Lulu nerfed.

I was wondering how long it would take people to start complaining about any sort of Lulu buff. :/ I was kind of hoping people would be too busy looking at warwick to notice.....

Sigh... Hopefully they don't remove it... I would love to pick up my old main again, but currently other utility supports just seem like much better picks so it is feels hard to justify picking her currently. TT_TT

agree, now when people encounter Lulu, they have nothing to be fear of. Lulu cannot protect herself like janna does, she does not do enough damage like sona/karma to make people fear to trade her, she runs slow and whimsy cannot save her a lot. So, she is supposed to protect allies but she isnt able to protect herself. I believe the buff can merely help lulu, maybe poking in a long run. But a whole lulu combo costs hella mana(E+Q), so i think they need to think of another way to buff lulu. 
PS: Lulu big fan, i really want to play her but I just never find a good situation to pull her out. Maybe in a situation that my team can completely carry me and be like they don't need a support and they can win a 4v5?
So you play Lulu as utility support. Tell me, how exactly is this buff going to help her in this role?

Poking I find actually helps a lot I find when I support. If you keep them low health it makes it risky for them to go all in, especially if you deny them vision. If they are low health it also makes farming less safe and the enemy adc is more likely to fall behind making the match up easier for your own adc.

Lastly it will also help if your adc is an idiot and keeps running into the jungle to chase the jungler who has been fed 15 kills by mid and top. XD When he dies because of it you'll have more push/poke to be able to protect the turret under siege better and buy your own jungler time to make it to bot and save the turret. Something that is quite useful these days, given the number of ganks bot gets. Even with Lulu's cc it is hard to survive a 3v1 under turret very long if you have no damage to discourage a dive.

I think some degree of damage or at least poking is useful even as a utility support. Part of why Sona is good  is she does both. Nami also has decent damage and stands a reasonable chance of winning (even with a standard support build) in a 1v1 if the engage from the enemy was poorly thought out ( or even a 2v1 if they decide to play really risky and tower dive you). Damage is it's own utility in a way as it allows you to discourage the enemy from attempting certain plays.

It is an AP scaling buff, as you said, so it won't be a huge buff to support Lulu, but it will be some and I'll take anything. ^_^;; I do normally build {{item:3092}} and {{item:3504}} on Lulu so I'll get some increased damage. (in addition to sight stone and redemption of course, but those are not relevant to the ap scaling damage conversation. XD Just wanted to add that before anyone got on to me for not listing those. )

They can't make Lulu work as a support without being too strong solo lane. Might as well embrace her as a solo lane supportive champ.
Ivern showed that supportive champs don't need to have shit scalings and be locked into botlane.

I hope they keep the 20% AP buff to her. I would much rather fight {{champion:117}} top as a melee champion then fight {{champion:133}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:126}}. Yes Lulu is hard to kill but her damage is not really all that scary and easily manageable. Just rush a {{item:3211}} and watch her damage drop a lot, since all she has for damage is her Q (and E if she uses it on you instead of shields herself) and then her passive bolts. You could just sit behind minions and have them block the passive bolts, and a decent amount of her Q's damage.

Once you transition to Mid/Late game she is just nothing but a strong support (Unless it's AD or AP On-hit Lulu). I don't get why people are crying over her being buffed, I never had a problem with top lane Lulu even back in Season 5 or when ever she was super common top lane.

her solo lane is trash anyway after the recent Q nerfs. Supports also have decent AP itemization now, so I wouldn't ignore it completely.

thats a 0.14 AP ratio buff to her wave clear, (cause 30% REDUCED damage beyond the first target hit)

And lets asume she has  0-600 AP.

0-84 extra damage  at min 1-30 wont break her.

Im sorry, but you're wrong.

It's only 30% reduced damage beyond first target.
And its 0.2 AP ratio on ability with ~4s CD, which is pretty huge
Why im getting downvoted? I merely stated facts O_O

no really, its not. 

a 1 hit 0.2 AP ratio (AND 0.14 every successive hit) every 7 SECONDS, is not huge.

Theese buffs are needed, lulu is in a pretty trashy spot. She should be meta right now, since redemption is so strong, and she synergizes well with it, but her winrate is still below 50%.

You're acting as if CDR wasn't a thing.

She doesn't synergise with Redemption any more than any other champion in game AND her Q ratio buff won't change a thing about her SUPPORT LULU
